alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Menifee; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 8:35AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Bath, north central Menifee, southeastern Fleming and Rowan Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 835 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sharkey, or near Morehead, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Munson around 840 AM EDT. Morehead, Salt Lick, Farmers, Midland and Rodburn around 845 AM EDT. Bluestone, Freestone, Brandy, Clearfield and Christy around 850 AM EDT. Cogswell, Crix and Young Springs around 855 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Zilpo, Yale, Lick Fork and Pelfrey. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 127 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
